forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. South wind around 2 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 2 to 8 mph.

weather_report:
As the early morning light creeps into Downtown San Francisco, it brings with it a gentle layer of fog, softly caressing the hills and wrapping around the iconic skyline. The air is cool, a whisper of what autumn holds, with temperatures hovering around the low fifties. The forecast hints at a transition as the dawn gives way to a predominantly sunny Saturday, but for now, the city embraces its usual melancholic charm, the muted colors amplifying the allure of the familiar streets.

As the day unfolds, expect the skies to brighten and the warmth to seep in, with a high nearing a comfortable sixty-four degrees, gently dipping to a cooler sixty by afternoon. A light breeze from the south may stir the air, but it should remain a serene companion throughout the day. Given the cool start, dressing in layers would be wise — a light sweater or jacket to ward off the chill in the early hours will serve you well, yet be prepared to shed it as the warmth of the afternoon envelops the day.

This pleasant weather beckons leisurely strolls through the city, perhaps meandering through the quieter streets of the Mission or enjoying a moment at one of the many parks. The low-hanging fog adds an air of mystique, making every corner feel like a scene from a story waiting to be explored. Whether sipping coffee in a sunlit café or trimming your weekend plans with a stroll to the Golden Gate, savor the simple pleasures this beautiful San Francisco day unfolds.
